tp:docstring.p: A channel request is an object in the ChannelDispatcher representing an ongoing request for some channels to be created or found. There can be any number of ChannelRequest objects at the same time.
Its well-known bus name is the same as that of the ChannelDispatcher, "org.freedesktop.Telepathy.ChannelDispatcher".

tp:rationale.p: See ChannelDispatcher.DRAFT.CreateChannel for rationale for ChannelRequest being a separate object.

tp:docstring.p: The time at which user action occurred, or 0 if this channel request is for some reason not involving user action.
This corresponds to the _NET_WM_USER_TIME property in EWMH.
This property is set when the channel request is created, and can never change.
An array of dictionaries containing desirable properties for the channel or channels to be created.

tp:rationale.p: This is an array so that we could add a CreateChannels method in future without redefining the API of ChannelRequest.

tp:docstring.p: This property is set when the channel request is created, and can never change.
This method SHOULD return immediately; on success, the request might still fail, but this will be indicated asynchronously by the Failed signal.
(FIXME: or do we define some errors here too?)

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Errors.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: This method has already been called, so it is no longer available. Stop calling it.

tp:docstring.p: The channel request has failed. It is no longer present, and further methods must not be called on it.

arg.name: Error
arg.tp:docstring: The name of a D-Bus error. This can come from various sources, including the error raised by CreateChannel, or an error generated to represent failure to establish the Connection.

arg.name: Message
arg.tp:docstring: If the first argument of the D-Bus error message was a string, that string. Otherwise, an empty string.

tp:docstring.p: The channel request has succeeded. It is no longer present, and further methods must not be called on it.
(FIXME: does this signal really need to tell the caller the channels that were produced?)

tp:rationale.p: CreateChannel can only produce one channel, but this argument is an array to allow for future addition of a CreateChannels method if it turns out to be necessary.
